subject: Re: [junit] One junit3.8.1 self-test failing
msgSnippet: ... Just a clarification, you _do_ need to add it to your classpath. There s no special feature that adds *.jar in the current directory to the classpath. As
messageBody:
merrilldave <dmerrill@...> skrev:
> (I omitted this step from the read-me instructions:
> set classpath=%classpath%;C:\Program Files\JavaPackages\junit3.8.1
>
> ...because the cmd prompt is running from the junit3.8.1 dir, so it's
> effectively in the classpath already. Right? In any case, doing that
> first makes no difference to the test result.)

Just a clarification, you _do_ need to add it to your classpath. There's no
special feature that adds *.jar in the current directory to the classpath.

As for jUnit itself, it works fine for me, running Windows NT and Java 1.5:

C:>echo %classpath%
.;C:\Program\SQLLIB\java\db2java.zip;C:\Program\SQLLIB\java\runtime.zip;C:\Program\SQLLIB\java\sqlj.zip;C:\Program\SQLLIB\bin;C:\Temp\junit3.8.1\junit.jar

C:>java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
.........................................
.........................................
.....................................
Time: 0,672

OK (119 tests)


C:>java -version
java version "1.5.0_02"
Java(TM) 2 Runtime Environment, Standard Edition (build 1.5.0_02-b09)
Java HotSpot(TM) Client VM (build 1.5.0_02-b09, mixed mode, sharing)

C:>
